message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about navigation and magnetic compasses. A ship navigates with a magnetic compass because it is predictable. A magnetic compass aligns itself with the Earth's magnetic field and provides a reliable and consistent means of determining direction. Option (A) is incorrect because a magnetic compass is not unpredictable. Option (B) is unrelated to the purpose of a magnetic compass. Option (C) may be a reason for some ships to use a magnetic compass, but it is not the main reason. The main reason is that a magnetic compass is predictable and consistent.

This question requires knowledge about navigation and the use of magnetic compasses on ships. Ships navigate using magnetic compasses because they are predictable. A magnetic compass points towards the Earth's magnetic north pole, which provides a consistent reference point for navigation. Option (A) is incorrect because the use of a magnetic compass actually helps make navigation more predictable. Option (B) is incorrect because the ability to withstand water is not relevant to the use of a magnetic compass. Option (C) may be a contributing factor to why magnetic compasses are still used on ships, but it does not explain why they are used in the first place.
